38649927.review:
[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
- Блестяще выполненный Коммон рут, полный умопомрачительного юмора. Я совершенно не ожидал увидеть сюжет такого качества в простой визуальной новелле
- Он довольно долгий, занимает где-то 30-40% игры
- Занятные персонажи. Каждый со своим характером и причудами
- Увлекательные и безумно забавные мини-игры в коммон руте. Управление в бейсболе тяжело, но приятно осваивать, а случайные поединки, периодически проходящие в школе невероятно абсурдны и смешны
- Удобная навигация по тексту

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
- Если коммон рут заставляет часами смеяться, то руты основных героинь - это вялое унылое сопливо - слезливое болото. Главные герои вдруг начинают вести себя абсолютно не адекватно ситуации и от этого нагоняют ещё больше сопливо - слезливой унылой вялой мути
- В принципе, что-то из этого можно почитать, например историю Куд, но, в основном, всё это на "любителя"
- Голоса некоторых героинь сильно режут слух, но, если их приглушить, то на это не обращаешь внимания
- Хотелось бы чтобы вся игра состояла из такой же искромётной комедии, как в коммон руте
- Нет 18+ патча! Из-за этого пришлось скачивать оригинальную игру и учить японский. (Это того не стоило)

[h1]Нельзя отнести ни к плюсам, ни к минусам:[/h1]
- Мини-игры необязательны в прохождении и могут быть проскипаны

[h1]Итого:[/h1]
Сейчас, на зимней распродаже, для всех желающих поднять себе настроение, это идеальный вариант покупки к новогодним праздникам

38626620.review:
This game is youth itself. It's a beautiful and engaging story of friendship and love, happiness and fun, sadness and grief. It shows you ways of dealing with loss and tragedy and overcoming one's own fears and trauma in order to once again grasp the happiness that awaits beyond. A rollercoaster of emotions, created by Key, the masters of their craft, who have incorporated their experiences and new ideas, gained over a long process of writing stories that tightly grip the hearts of their readers time and time again.

The Little Busters have set out on an important mission: To make new friends and have as much fun as they possibly can while they're still young. Their leader Kyousuke never runs out of ideas as they transform their everyday lives in memories of happiness with their silly antics. 
Beginning with an energetic narrative of youth and friendship, the story then becomes more serious as our protagonist, Naoe Riki, discovers love and is faced with harsh trials of life that may hit anyone, at any time. This is where the friendship of the Little Busters truly shines, as they come together to help their members endure the pain and deal with their problems and eventually become stronger.

Little Busters is my favorite game. It has become a part of me and taught me many things. Even among the masterpieces of Key, this game will always be special to me.

38364823.review:
Video review (including score): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y30sadzLkrU
Ten years after its initial Japanese release, Little Busters! finally makes its way to English audiences. It is a game that I have been wanting to play for years now, as I am a big fan of Key’s previous works, having seen all of their respective anime adaptations. Clannad is my all-time favorite work of fiction across any medium, so I had very high expectations going into this game.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]Great characterization.[/b] As with Key’s previous works, the game is built around its characters. The whole goal is to build up these characters so much so that the player becomes attached to them and really gets to know them. This is an aspect that Key has always been good at and Little Busters! is no exception. The character routes expand on each character in-depth, usually by exploring said character’s past, giving the player insight into why each character acts the way they do. During that process, these characters are really brought to life.

[b]Fantastic soundtrack.[/b] The Clannad Original Soundtrack is my all-time favorite soundtrack, so knowing that the Little Busters! soundtrack shares some of the same composers, I had similar expectations. These expectations were met for the most part. There are several standout tracks in the soundtrack, with only a few on the weaker side. “BOYS DON’T CRY” is a great example of one of the better tracks from the game and might be my favorite, although it is hard to choose.

It is not just the excellent background music that makes this soundtrack so good. The opening theme is just as good, with the English localization even including karaoke on-screen when it plays, just as one would find on a lot of today’s fansubbed anime. The different ending themes were of varying quality, but none of them were bad. The main insert song, titled “Faraway”, is easily the best vocal track in the game though. I would be lying if I said I did not shed a tear or two when that one started playing during the Refrain route. Overall though, the Little Busters! Original Soundtrack is just another great work to come out of Key Sounds Label.

[b]The Refrain Route.[/b] I had a great time going through most of the character routes, but all of them pale in comparison to the game’s true ending, the Refrain route. Sure, the character routes are supposed to invoke some sort of emotional response, but I did not shed a single tear until I got to the Refrain route. This is coming from someone who rarely feels any emotion for fictional characters, let alone shed a tear for one. I can count the number of times this has happened on one hand, Little Busters! now included. It is just that good. The emotional payoff in the Refrain route is easily worth the 60 or so hours it took to get to that point. This all just further cements my opinion that Jun Maeda is the best writer in the industry.

[b]Busterpedia.[/b] The Busterpedia is a great addition for the English version, especially for those that may not know a lot about Japanese culture. It is basically an in-game dictionary, highlighting certain words, phrases, or names that the player may not know. Clicking on the highlighted word, phrase, or name brings up its definition. It can also can be accessed at anytime from the main menu or the in-game menu. I consider myself at least somewhat knowledgeable about Japanese culture, but there was still several terms and names that I was not familiar with, so the Busterpedia was rather helpful in that regard. The definitions range from simple words that are rather well-known, like Tatami, up to terms like Ogura Hyakunin Isshu, the name of a Japanese poetry anthology published in the 12th century.

[b]The variety of mini-games.[/b] Despite Little Busters! being a visual novel, there are plenty of mini-games included that span a variety of genres. First, there is the battle system. This aspect of the game basically has the player collecting items to increase his/her stats and up his/her position on the battle rankings leaderboard throughout the course of the game. There is also the batting practice mini-game, which is a bit more involved compared to the battle system. This one has the player moving left and right then pressing space when the perfect pitch is lined up. Playing this mini-game builds stats for each character participating in the practice, which helps in both the battle system and the actual baseball game played during the common route.

Even more involved than the baseball mini-game is the dungeon crawler present in Saya’s route, which can be accessed after clearing Refrain. It is a full-blown dungeon crawler implemented right into a visual novel, with trap rooms and a shooting gallery mini-game when enemies appear. There are a few others as well, but these three are the standout ones. These mini-games do not hinder the experience at all and can be disabled by the player if he/she does not want to bother with them. They just serve as some additional fun to have while playing through the main game. I personally had a lot of fun tracking down the different achievements that can be earned by participating in these mini-games.

[b]Wealth of content.[/b] Steam says I have logged over 150 hours in this game and, while some of that time may have been spent idling, I would not be surprised if my actual playtime came in at around 80 hours. It took over a month of on-and-off playing to finish the game. There is simply that much content present in Little Busters!. The common route is very long, with each character route taking a reasonable amount of time to clear as well. The true ending, the Refrain route, is also of decent length. Adding in all of the extra content, such as the bonus routes and mini-games, and you are left with quite the package.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]Some rushed character routes.[/b] I did mention previously that each character route takes considerable time to clear, but that does not mean each is well-paced. There were a few character routes that felt rushed towards the end. It was as if the one writing the route was suddenly out of time and had to crank out an ending as quickly as possible. This was very noticeable with Kud’s route, my least favorite in the game because of just how jarring the sudden shift in pacing was towards the end of the route. Without spoiling, I will just say that the last 15% or so of that route became quit the mess, a very different feeling compared to the rest of the route. This was not the case with all the routes though, just a few. It is quite the shame actually, as a couple of these rushed routes started off great, only to lose their appeal as the pacing increased.

[b]Typos and grammar issues.[/b] The game is made up of over one million words, so I expected the occasional typo or two. They were not all that common, not enough to really bother me, but it should be noted regardless. I noticed that the majority of these typos appeared during the Ecstasy routes, the three routes unlocked after completing Refrain. Perhaps it is because the Ecstasy content was never translated prior to this release, whereas the translation of the base game has been out for years and served as the foundation for this English Edition, allowing for any typos to be ironed out.

[h1]Overall:[/h1]
With each release, Key continues to set the standard for what a good visual novel should strive to be. The game met my high expectations and it is the first visual novel to have impacted me on such an emotional level, enough so that I had to fight back tears. From its great characterization to its fun mini-games, Little Busters! does just about everything right, with only a few rushed character routes bringing down the experience. Highly recommended for visual novel fans and those that enjoy impactful stories.

Full review: https://cublikefoot.com/2017/12/16/little-busters-english-edition-actual-game-review/

38329364.review:
Plenty of other reviews give this game ample praise.

People who are still on the fence should note that the minigames might not be as fluid or easy as one might expect.

Yours truly, for example, utterly fails at the baseball segments.  That one food minigame was a frantic haze of clicking and desperate but silent pleas that our score would end up high enough.  There's also another timing minigame with amusing results all around but I swear the RNG or whatever you'd call it is guaranteed to mess with a certain character in very unpleasant ways.

Oh well, you can turn most of the minigames off if you wish, and that helps keep one's focus on the amazing story.

As a whole?  I totally parrot all those other positive reviews.  This is an amazing VN and one of the finest in the genre.

37955062.review:
A wonderful visual novel about friendship, growing up, and muscles. Lots of muscles.

Little Busters is two tons of fun, and is arguably some of the best entertainment I've had reading a VN. It has minigames and choices sprinkled throughout, and plenty of shenanigans/jokes to keep you entertained. The pacing overall is pretty good, and there were very few times when I felt like things were dragging on. This is crucial because of LB's staggering length of nearly 1.5 million words (almost double the length of the Bible) and over 90 hours of content, making it one of the longest visual novels ever written.

LB isn't all fun and games though. Later on it will hit you with tragic stories and heavy character drama. While it's not as potent as Clannad (one of Key's most famous VNs) in that regard, don't be surprised if at the end of a character route you're in tears.

That brings me to Little Busters' other strength: investment in characters. The male supporting cast of Kyousuke, Masato and Kengo is outstanding, which is a rarity in non-otome visual novels. They all have depth and complexity in their character, even the silly comic relief Masato (one of my favorite comic relief characters ever). For me, the female characters ranged from very good to mediocre, but these three guys stole the show. I'll definitely remember them long after I've moved on to other stories.

The character routes are a bit of a mixed bag for me. Some of them I loved, others I only thought were ok. However, when Little Busters lands a hit, it really knocks it out of the park. And that's why you should play it.

37747308.review:
Have you ever wished for something? Something you wanted so badly, that you would move heaven and earth to have it, even if your wish could only give a fleeting moment of happiness? 

There are times in life where despite still being not too old, I yearn anyway for those blissful days of bygone youth, where you felt nothing could stop you and your friends from taking on the world. Those innocent playful days felt endless... But time never stops, childhood innocence is never for granted, and the oftentimes crueler hardships that come with this reality are ready at a moments notice to overtake us all whether or not we're ready to deal with them.

This VN captures those youthful days as it follows the lives of a small group of friends who call themselves the Little Busters, a group made just to enjoy those days while they last. They spend their days playing baseball, causing a ruckus, and maybe even solving some problems along the way. Always cheerfully pushing forward with song and smile. Always looking to enjoy the moment and help others enjoy the moment too when they really need a helping hand.

It's a beautiful story about friends and how we mature and grow stronger to face those issues that life will just hurl at us. Each character develops and matures from where they start out to the point where you just feel proud for them when they do overcome their hardships. Some characters even surprise you in how they handle their lot life has drawn for them. Things get deeply emotional and heartrending at times with the plights of some characters, and the game can easily veer off into the melodramatic at times for some people's tastes. But I think the game has so much more stronger moments than these weaker moments.

In terms of the quality, this is a labor of love from the translators. The folks at Fruitbat Factory did the original fan translation and have now finally their hard work is officially approved. I can only imagine the elation they have over this, and I would think this would be the dream of any fan who is passionate enough to do something like a fan translation. They deserve it though, as the VN is as perfect as it can be. Absolutely no complaints about the system. It does its job.

[h1]I have read a fair amount of visual novels, and I still have many more to go, but this has easily become one of my favorites thus far and perhaps will always be so. I highly recommend it for any VN fan for its beautiful story, music, and characters... and after finishing this I don't think I'll be forgetting about the Little Busters any time soon. After all, life may constantly move forward, but the Little Busters are eternal.[/h1]

36920132.review:
Little Busters is one of my favourite VN(Visual Novel). I probably completed it 3 or 4 times before it was released on steam and I completed it here again.

What's to say about LB?

-It's basically Little Busters Perfect Edition from Japan with English included, the latest version of it ever.
-Made by KEY(known for Kanon, Clannad, Air, Rewrite).
-One of the writers is Jun Maeda, who besides working on many KEY VNs, he's known for the anime Angel Beats and Charlotte.
-Good story, with plenty of friendship and drama.
-It's hilarious and fun. The kind of reading where you smile even when there aren't any jokes.
-9 routes and all of them worth reading.
-Memorable characters, I like even the male dormitory head who has I think about 6 lines of dialogue.
-Great art.
-Good music.
-A big cat.
-Friendship.
-Battles.

Now there are few things I'm not a fan of:

-Baseball minigame gets repetitive fast(all minigames can be skipped).
-Game was made originally in a 4:3 aspect ratio and this edition is 16:9. It doesn't affect much most of the time, but CG scenes will be cut and you need to press "space bar" and use the scroll wheel of your mouse to zoom out to see the whole picture. It should've been included an option to play in the original aspect ratio.
-Some CGs were changed slightly from the first released version of Little Busters. I don't know if they changed it in the Perfect Edition but even if they did I find it annoying.

Also, I don't care but it doesn't have any 18+ scenes and it's highly doubtful it will have a patch, the Perfect Edition of LB! from Japan doesn't have it, too.

To sum it up, I think Little Busters! is the best VN you can find on steam right now.

36917759.review:
I'm glad that VisualArts/Key is finally releasing their visual novels in English now.
I know Clannad was by Sekai Project (I backed their Kickstarter) but I guess in a way that was a catalyst for VisualArts/Key to release their games in English for the western world.

Like most of VisualArts/Key visual novels, this one is also a wonderful masterpiece.
It is quite lengthy (like most of Key/VisualArts' visual novels), but in a way that's a good thing -- it'll keep you busy for a good while.

The game has 1280 by 720 (HD) art assets which is very good for a visual novel that is over 10 years old.

I myself have quite a lot still to go through, but that's all part of the experience of visual novels. :)

36896303.review:
During the past several years I've read plenty of VNs, however this gem was hidden from my sight for too long. A mistake on my part for not noticing it and not acknowledging its' brilliance long ago. 

Being a VN, its' main selling point is the story. Some people would say replayability, but it would be a bit of a misconception. Replayability comes from the desire of a player/reader to explore more and to know more about the world (s)he dives in. 
The same thing happened to me. 

I was so engrossed by it that have already spent 42 hours. Not just because of the story and its hillariousness but also because of the mini-games it has. Strangely enough, they are not annoying. On the contrary, most of the laughs I've received from them. No matter how ridiculously stupid (however clever at the same time) the dialogs can be, they are not even close to the absurdity of situations within these games.

Just read it already. Buy it and read it. You will certainly love some characters, remember some scenes and definitely learn something from experiencing that... incredible world. Give it a shot, it will not disappoing. 

But please be advised, this read is addictive and will require a lot, and I mean A LOT of your time. Just FYI.

36434658.review:
Gotta love well done [spoiler]time loop[/spoiler] stories. I originally played through a lot of this with an old fan translation, but the new official translation, along with 3 new routes and all the bonus content is well worth revisiting. I'd probably rate this alongside my favorite VN's...The story is great, especially once everything is explained in refrain and all truth comes to light. Even before the thrilling concluding arc there are so many moments, of happiness, grief, all done so well and conveyed magnificently.

Once you've figured out the secret of the world, all the [spoiler]supernatural happenings[/spoiler] begin to make sense, and you can look at the story in an entirely new light... Which also explains why [spoiler]Rin begins to become more active with the routes as you continue, and why more things appear over time. All of the characters were picked based on their unfinished last wishes, and it conveys beautifully through the plot while helping to better drive Riki and Rin to their purpose of becoming strong together. All in order to face that horrible world that they must face together.[/spoiler]

This, similar to Clannad, has tons of options. When you think interactivity in a visual novel, Little Busters should probably be the first thing that comes to mind. Not only do all the options completely change course and make or break your route, (there's so many different bad ends for each heroine... Lots of them are interesting to read, and again... Once you find the secret of the world, they make more sense) but there's tons of fun little mini games as well. You may turn on/off each minigame as you wish, and they won't hinder story progression [spoiler]however, once you get to saya route, if you can't successfully do the shooting minigame(and have it turned on), you may be in for a pickle, as you'll have to keep replaying over and over until you complete it.[/spoiler] It isn't just there to pad the story length and make it longer, though. For example, in [spoiler]Batting Practice, you'll increase the stats of your characters as you play ball, allowing you to complete some more story fights/get ready for the big game. Lots of bonus text behind these things, and the battle rankings can be outright hilarious.[/spoiler]

The soundtrack is absolutely amazing, and this (as far as I know) is key's longest visual novel. I'm not absolutely sure if perfect edition is over clannad in word length, but EX was by 4000 words, and this is EX with modified/new content(removed 18+ however). The visuals are great, and the voice acting is superb. The three new routes included from EX are all great fun to play, and one [spoiler]even takes place after the incident, which is an interesting perspective.[/spoiler]

If you have any interest in visual novels at all, this one will be the most bang for your buck, and the minigames are all fun as well [spoiler]though the dungeon crawler is a bit repetitive, Luckily on the final playthrough the route, it's much simplified... and hilarious if I might add.[/spoiler] So equally, if you're a visual novel veteran, or looking to get started into visual novels, this is a grand choice and should definitely make your list. [spoiler]To top it all off, it's one of those games where all routes are canon. Gotta love the dedication for those.[/spoiler]  This is the second novel to receive a 10/10 from me, the first being the muv-luv trilogy. Absolutely recommend this.

36433123.review:
I played/read this title years ago and it was really something special. It's charming, relatable, funny, sad, and it's a work of art!

When I first played through the novel, I was in high school with an old beat up laptop. After upgrading to a new laptop, I once again attempted to find it somewhere online, some download with the english subtitles, but after the famous takedown of most reliable torrent sites, I gave up. Then the anime came out and I was so excited to finally feel the same way I did years ago, but it failed to meet my expectations. It was good, but not THIS good.

Then, a few days ago, I read an article on PC Gamer. "Little Busters! English Edition" on sale on Steam for the next week. My eyes lit up and I was once again filled with the excitement I felt years ago! Even on the base common route I can already feel all the emotions flooding back to me, and I can't wait to read this again. This visual novel is truly a gem for the ages. Highly recommended for anyone.

This game is a masterpiece in its genre. The port is nice and accomodates widescreen displays while still allowing you to view all of the CG in the original 4:3 aspect ratio so that you don't miss any of the details. The only negative that I have to mention is that the translation quite obviously wasn't completely done yet, although it is most definitely excellent. For example, there are some grammatical errors that occasionally pop up along with at least one untranslated japanese line I've found in Sasami's route (It wasn't because I accidentally switched the language to Japanese, which is also an excellent feature available in this version of the game.) You really feel that the translators cared about what they were doing. I'm pretty sure this particular translation is based off of the fan patch from a while back, by the way.

The only complaint I really have about this release is that west will likely never see any of 18+ that Ecstasy shipped with, but that's not what Key novels are about anyways. This game is worth the 35 dollars and more.

36286251.review:
tl;dr: Get it, it's great.

I read a fair number of visual novels, including fan translated ones and officially released ones. I read Little Busters! when the fan translation came out several years back and it's safe to say it's my favorite visual novel of all time. It isn't without its flaws; for one, there were a couple of character routes that were either a bit confusing or maybe not the greatest, but this is limited to those particular character routes. The common route, the main story, and the routes written by Yuuto Tonokawa and Jun Maeda were all extremely good and memorable. The main storyline especially is one of the best I've ever read in a visual novel, and the main cast especially is an absolute blast and very memorable. The heroines are a bit more of a mixed bag; some of them really stand out and had a strong presence, while others... not so much. But even the ones I'm not huge on are, at worst, just not very great. There's nothing there that's offensively bad, and far more often than not what is there is extremely good.

This release adds three character routes (Sasami, Kanata, and Saya) that were not present in the original fan translation. These routes are locked behind the main story as far as I can tell; you can't complete them until the main story is complete, and there is no option for returning players to specify that they have already completed the story. While this is kind of understandable, I think it would have been nice to include some way to unlock it for people who have already read the fan translation. As far as the quality of the routes, I can't comment since I haven't read them yet, but based on the writers responsible for each route, I expect two of them to be pretty high quality and the remaining one could go either way.

All of the other features you'd expect from a VN are, for the most part, present. There's a mouseover encyclopedia for Japanese terms that English readers may be unfamiliar with, which is a welcome and common-sense addition in my opinion. There is also the option to switch everything to Japanese text, which (although kind of strange in an English release) would be perfectly fine except that there's a mouse shortcut to toggle this that's relatively easy to trigger on accident (click LMB and RMB at the same time). Volume settings for BGM, character voices, individual character voices, and sound effects are all there, which is good because the defaults seemed really strange to me; sound effects and male characters were extremely quiet while the BGM and certain female characters were all very loud. Other than that, this release is supposedly also compatible with touchscreens. I can't comment on that, but it does look like the settings are there, so if you like to play on a tablet or something, it seems you can do that.

Overall, this is a great release. There are minor things here or there that stick out to me, but nothing really earth-shattering. If you have even the slightest interest in this kind of visual novel or if you're a fan of any of Key's other works, definitely pick this up right away. If you played the original fan translated version, I'd recommend grabbing it for the extra character routes; I believe there is an unlocked save file for you in the "guides" section on the Steam Community if you really don't want to do a full replay (I'm just going to do a full replay, though). Either way, this is a definite buy for me.

Edit:
When I wrote this review, the last time I had read Little Busters! had been in 2013 or so. Now that I'm almost finished with it again (I've completed all the main routes again as well as two of the added routes; I still haven't read Saya's), I want to say that I liked Chika Shirokiri's routes a lot better now than I did the first time I read them. It's also worth saying that the additional route that he (she?) wrote (which is great on its own and feels like a full, complete route) adds a sort of resolution that was kind of lacking in one of the original routes and made what I thought was already a good scenario even better.

As for the additional route written by Tonokawa, it was nice and very cute but rather short and lacking in the impact that his other routes had. It's not bad by any means, but it definitely feels more like a fandisc route. A little disappointing, but it was fun so I can't complain.

Saya's route was all right. A lot of fun but I personally wasn't huge on the way it played out.

36278925.review:
Visto che manca una valutazione italiana di questo prodotto mi appresto a rimediare, qui su Steam non l'ho finito ma anni fa in una versione non ufficiale patchata avevo esplorato meglio questa visual novel.
Per una recensione seria aspetto di aver finito al 100% il gioco, descriverò comunque a chi può piacere; quest'opera è un Nakige, un tipo di commedia drammatica che punta inizialmente a farti empatizzare con i personaggi attraverso molte scene quotidiane spesso comiche e sopra le righe, andando avanti e sviluppato il background di ciascuno, attraverso colpi di scena   o altro, la storia saprà farsi veramente seria e drammatica... non dico altro.
È più facile poterlo apprezzare fin da subito se la presenza di molte scene Slice of Life fa per voi, dato che non ve ne sono poche, sono diverse parti che puntano più a farvi legare all'universo narrativo più che a mandare avanti la trama principale(vari minigiochi divertenti fanno scorrere ancor meglio il tutto); tralascinado quel minimo di sensibilità richiesto per apprezzare il dramma, che vi piaccia il moe o meno, è innegabile la potenza dei temi che tratta Little Busters! I suoi argomenti principali, spesso abusati in altre storie sono come tema l'Amicizia e come premessa la Crescita ma potete fidarvi sul fatto che qui siano l'opposto di ogni forma di banalità, come tratta i rapporti tra le persone quest'opera, non ne tratta nessun'altra.
Nonostante i grandi pregi della produzione, credo che ciò che può veramente essere un argomento di discussione molto opinabile è il True End(non farò spoiler) che piacerà sicuramente a una cerchia ma potrebbe non prendere le corde di alcuni; personalmente l'ho apprezato e il modo in cui ci si arriva è strettamenente collegato ai temi, tuttavia non rasenta il punto saliente raggiunto poco prima... di conseguenza ciò che sognerei di quest'opera è proprio un sequel che mi emozioni altrettanto, non è stato lasciato nulla in sospeso ma ritengo che per una conclusione si possa fare ancora di più, cosa che effettivamente il gioco fa con la route di Saya(una delle route giocabili dopo il True Ending), seppur la stessa non sia proprio un sequel.  
In ogni caso se avete già apprezzato altri prodotti della Key(Clannad, Air, Rewrite, Angel Brats e ecc...) o trasposizioni animate, fa sicuramente per voi; purtroppo quest'opera non ha ricevuto un adattamento totalmente degno(nenche troppo orrido me è ben lontano), tuttavia ecco qui a voi, ufficialmente in occidente, una delle visual novel più sublimi e importanti che siano mai state fatte, dargli almeno un'occhiata non sarebbe di certo una cattiva idea ;)

Do you have that one movie, anime, book or any other kind of experience you love so much that if you had the chance to erase that memory to live it again for the first time you would do it? That's Little Busters! for me. It helped me grow as a person, and for that I am grateful.

I first played the VN in Winter 2012 when the anime was airing, and I've been in love ever since. I won't write too many details because the best way of experiencing the game is by playing it. The characters have amazing development, the OST is perfect (as per usual from Key), the common route is a great slice of life. Don't spoil yourself, if you want to look recomended route orders go for it, but that's about how much you should look. Try to get to them on your own with no walkthroughs, it enriches the experience.

If this is your first VN, don't be afraid of the lenght of the game. Play it on your own pace and when you least expect it you will be playing it all day, and when you're not playing it you will be eagerly awaiting for the next opportunity.

I don't know how to write a review, but this game brought me so much that I feel like I have to try at least. If this is the small push you need to buy Little Busters! I hope this helps you make your mind. If at least one person decides to play because of my small text, then I'm already happy.

EX全cg之后觉得已经没什么词能形容我的感受了，我目前玩过的最好的galgame，没有之一。而且LB在key厨的评价中也是和kanon和cl air齐名。
LB讲了一个感动的 关于友情的故事，一个成长的故事，即使他和爱情关系很大，即使他有R18的内容，但这不影响他在主题：“寻找世界的秘密”中展现友情的力量。
LB的角色如此之多却又每个都性格分明，令人怜爱，不得不说key社不管是做搞笑内容还是虐心内容都是一流的。比如沙耶线中我是在电脑前边哭着边看完R18情节的。LB的虐并不是现在我们所说的虐，而是感动。不像其他游戏，虐完全就是为了虐，各种强行喂屎，白学，死人，智商下线..LB中的情节，存在就是存在的，不能称之为虐，也不能称之为致郁，不如说是治愈。
这款游戏仅仅只有160万字的阅读量，却创造出了如此长的篇幅，但长却根本不烂，各线事情紧凑，少有拖延，真正的在用心讲一个故事，以至于几乎每一条线可以当一个新故事，新的历程。战斗排位赛和棒球练习也是很有趣的，而且会影响一些隐藏剧情（LB的隐藏剧情太多了，太多选项都会影响后续个人线中的微小变化）

最后总结一下游戏中各种线：
小毬线，小叶子线，美鱼/美鸟线，来谷线，库特线，库特追加线，铃线，RF线(真结局)，佳奈多线，佐佐美线，沙耶线，笨蛋理树线，学园革命线，肌肉线
最感动的线：库特的两条线和学园革命线，还有RF线
最欢乐的线：筋肉线
有点没看懂，但看起来很牛逼的线：美鱼/美鸟线
BE最多的线：小叶子线
最压抑的线：玲线

36212237.review:
[i]"There is a secret to this world."[/i]

Do you like stories that manage to contain both a great deal of hillarious comedy and heartbreaking drama? How about a memorable cast of characters who are all well-developed and are just fun to spend time with? Perhaps some quirky minigames where "battles" are fought with whatever random objects happen to be at hand? Or perhaps a story revolving around themes such as friendship, growing up, and facing up to painful circumstances? If so, then Little Busters is the game you want to play.

Originally this game came out in 2007, had an "expanded" version released a year later, three seasons of an anime adaptation in 2012-2014, and likely more. But only now, 10 years after the original release, has this game finally recieved an official English release. To say that this was a highly anticipated release for me would be an understatement: Little Busters is one of my favorite VN's ever alongside the likes of Steins;Gate, Umineko, and its "elder sibling" Clannad that was made by the same developers back in 2004. Anyone who has already played Clannad on Steam, or is otherwise familiar with the works of Key/Visual Arts, has a pretty good idea of what to expect from this. And yet Little Busters, in my opinion, is an improvement upon its infamous predecessor.

A major reason why I think this is in no small part due to the cast. At the start, you are one of five childhood friends: Naoe Riki (you), Natsume Kyousuke, Inohara Masato, Miyazawa Kengo, and Natsume Rin. Now in high school and thinking about the unfortunate fact that adulthood will likely split them up, the Little Busters decide to have another fun adventure before that day arrives. As that adventure plays out, the group recieves new members and gets involved in all sorts of whacky shenanigans and hillarious conversations. Every major character (of which I count 13) is very well-developed and has a large amount of screentime. Characters that initially seem stereotypical or one-dimensional (such as the idiot friend Masato, the moe blob Kudryavka, and the hardass rules enforcer Kanata) end up revealing far more depth than first impressions would suggest, particularly when you get involved in their individual storylines. Lastly, one of the big plus points is that regardless of what story path you pursue, the other main cast members remain part of the plot, rather than just disappearing as they tended to do in Clannad and many other VN's.

The storyline for Little Busters is large, with no less than nine different character storylines to play through. There are a huge number of dialogue choices to make which can decide everything from what route you will pursue, what minor (potentially missable) scenes you will find, or what crazy battles you may end up getting involved with. It actually gets a little complex, as you will need to play the original six storylines (Komari, Rin 1, Kurugaya, Haruka, Kudryavka, and Mio) before being able to dig into the heavy drama and soul-crushing heartbreak that follows (Rin 2 and Refrain). Even after that is done, you still have even more to look for, with the unlocking of the three "extra" routes (Saya, Sasami, Kanata) as well as alternate endings for ones you have finished already. In other words... this game is massively packed with content, with something in the order of 100+ hours of gameplay to be had. There's probably plenty of stuff in this game I don't even know about. But despite its length, unlike many other VN's this is one I don't get bored playing. There's just too much fun (and drama) going on keeping me interested... and losing track of time in the process. XD

Ok, if it wasn't obvious at the start or throughout the course of this review, i'll just go ahead and spell it out as unambiguously as possible: I love this game. I was waiting for more than three years for it to get an English release, made a point of backing Clannad's Kickstarter with the opinion that if it succeeded then Little Busters might eventually get released too, and patiently waiting until, finally, the day finally arrived. At the present moment, I haven't played through the entirety of this release yet, but based on what I have seen so far (15 hours in at time of writing) this has been a quality port of a game I can't get enough of. Now I'm going to stop writing this so I can get back to the game. ^_^

[b]Mission... Start![/b]

Edit: Took me 92 hours to get 100% Completion.

This is the greatest visual novel ever written. A fine example of not dismissing a story solely based upon the medium with which that story is told. Life-changing, and much more than the lighthearted, playful romp all sorts of media outlets are claiming it to be now that the English version is out. Clannad may have the superior anime of the two, but Little Busters has the better novel, and overall the better story.

And yes, Little Busters will make you cry harder.

Seriously, this is a story that is brilliantly executed, with foreshadowing done so masterfully, you'll be both shocked at the plot twists, yet wondering how you didn't see them coming before then. Masquerading as a slice of life, this story lulls you into a false sense of security before hitting you where it hurts, over and over.

36200197.review:
My favourite visual novel has finally been officially translated! "Little Busters!" is a story about friendship first and foremost, featuring about 50+ hours of a mix of comedy, drama and a tiny bit of romance in each of the heroine routes.

In addition to the story there is a baseball and combat-ranking mini game running parallel to the story, plus some other mini games to keep things fresh. If you do not like them they are completely optional if you wish to experience the story only!

The steam release contains improved (although cropped for 16:9 ratio) 720p artwork, better controls and UI visuals and several other improvements compared to the original japanese release.
Just like in Clannad there is a small "Busterpedia" with term explanations for certain references made in the game.
This release also features the extra routes from the ME/EX versions of the game, however these cannot be accessed without playing through the main game first (unlike the original releases where you were offered the "Do you know the secret of this world?" skip option at the start of the game).

Just a heads up: The best part of this game are the common route and the "Refrain" (true) route. The heroine routes aren't bad, but they aren't exactly impressive either.

All in all, considering the low price compared to Clannad, I highly recommend picking this one up immediately.

Edit #1: It seems the CG is actually in the original 4:3 form, but only shows a 16:9 crop of the image. When viewing the CG without text (default: space bar) you can actually scroll the CG to view the rest of the original image!

36199846.review:
What "Adolescence" do you have? Do you remember childhood?

Where do I even start? This feels like a dream. Little Busters, officially released in English and accessible for everyone to enjoy on Steam. Acknowledged as one of the best visual novels of all time, and ten years later here it is. The three Ecstasy routes have been translated and made accessible for the first time, and just Little Busters as a whole is being made accessible to anyone. This game is the pinnacle of Maeda Jun's work no doubt. The pinnacle of Key, and the visual novel medium as a whole. Little Busters is an experience like no other, and now it has finally made it to today where there is an official English version based on the translation patch from years ago. No longer just a game that a very select few love and discuss the impacts of, but one that the rest of the world will be able to see, and hopefully discover for themselves too. No longer does the best visual novel of all time have to be obscure and hidden away, whilst I know that something like Key and Little Busters only attracts a select few for reasons such as being able to be immensely engaged in lengthy games that challenge philosophy and psychological viewpoints no matter your age or background, merely from a human standpoint. Something that only Maeda himself can and could master. I sincerely hope more people, people who maybe have never even played a visual novel, give it a chance and let themselves be immersed into one of the most life-changing experiences from a true masterpiece. 
I cannot encourage you enough, no matter your opinion or where you stand on the idea of VNs or Japanese games and media. Try Little Busters. Little Busters changed my life, impacted the way I was wired and how I process my own thoughts. Not only me, the other fans will agree, Little Busters will have your sub-conscious processing all sorts of ideas without you even realising. For you to piece it all together at the end and conclude how you too view not just the ideas conveyed in the game, but how you even live as a human in this world. The characters, whilst fictional, are written in a way where their relationships and feelings are intertwined with each other and feels real. Especially the original five, the warmth of their closely-knit childhood friendship is written beautifully and will engage you through a surreal experience like no other. When things become serious and you slowly make realisations throughout the game, you will cry like you never have before.
Then there is the soundtrack. Maeda Jun, Orito Shinji, PMMK and more. True geniuses of composing. The soundtrack of Little Busters will blow you away, lift you up, hit you hard on the floor and make you bawl, and put you at peace. Even the menu music, "Born into This World" (Umareochiru Sekai), is incredibly beautiful. Every detail of the whole game is wonderful and intricately placed and built together to create the masterpiece that is Little Busters.
I cannot recommend Little Busters enough, no matter who you are, please try Little Busters!

Let me start by saying that this novel is very near and dear to me. I happened to stumble accross it during a rough period in my life and it helped bring new life into me. I unfortunately was never very good at keeping friends because I moved around a lot as a kid. At my lowest this novel filled the gaping hole of friendship I had sought. The interactions between the characters feel so genuine yet unreachable in reality that it's envious. You can tell from reading the novel that this is a cherished work made with lots of love and is loved by those who have read it.

Pro's:
-Well established characters
-Balanced M:F ratio cast (excluding the 3 additions it's 4:6)
-Fantastic minigames
-Well placed humor that doesn't interrupt important moments
-Astounding Soundtrack
-Glossy visuals that bring out what's unique to each character.
-Story, stats and hidden dialogue progression unlocked each playthrough.
-VERY LONG (<70+ hours) Time and money worth.
Con's:
-Protagonist can sometimes fill a self-insert role.
-Some characters can be a bit off-putting at first.
-Gives you the feels (only if you're not ready is this really a con I guess.)

Please give this a read if you are even remotely interested. The humor is unlike anything you've seen and the stories all hold their own sense of situational gravity. Perhaps it may be as life changing for you as it was for me and others.

Спустя ровно год с момента последнего прохождения я вновь берусь за эту новеллу. Тогда я был в полном восторге от этого произведения. Персонажи запали в душу, их конфликты заставляли меня сопереживать, а концовка смогла выбить из меня скупую слезу. Я считал эту новеллу лучшим, что когда либо читал.

Так вот, прошла ли игра эту небольшую проверку временем?

Да!

Даже сейчас я продолжаю считать проказников большим успехом. За этот год я прочитал все произведения (За исключением Rewrite) от студии Key, и могу сказать, что LB! вышло самым удачным. Даже классическая троица в лице Kanon, Air и Clannad вышли более пресными и занудными, на мой взгляд. Стоит ли говорить о несчастном огрызке под названием Angel Beats? 

Little Busters прекрасно балансирует между драмой и комедией, не скатывая диалоги в трехчасовую невыносимую болтовню о деревянных морских звёздах. Коммон-рут не затянут, имеет множество довольно неплохих шуток и разбавлен минииграми. Многие руты прямо таки цепляют за живое, а рефрен вводит в ступор, заставляя полностью переосмыслить всё произошедшее раньше, отчего мне сейчас перечитывать эту новеллу будет в разы интереснее.

В общем, это вправду годная новелла, повествующая не столько о любви и дружбе, сколько о том, на что ты готов пойти ради своих друзей. Обязательная к прохождению всем любителям жанра накиге. И напоследок: 

Вы действительно хотите знать, в чём секрет этого мира?

36186761.review:
[h1]リトルバスターズ！——この青春を駆け抜けろ。[/h1]

首先，恭喜《Little Busters!》十周年企划首要任务Mission01——《Kud Wafter》动画化众筹达成200%六千万円目标，剧场版制作成功决定！哇呼！KEY社永不过气！╰(*°▽°*)╯
其次，《Little Busters!》十周年企划第四任务Mission04——《Little Busters!》英语化项目自登录Steam绿光到发售历经半年时间也终于在大家的翘首企盼中姗姗来迟(*/ω＼*)
那么，闲话少说，下面开始对这款KEY社在Steam上新鲜出炉的游戏作出一点微小的评测吧！

[h1][b]MISSION START![/b][/h1]


[u]游戏[/u]：本作与《CLANNAD》同为KEY社文本量很大的GALGAME，售价居然比《CLANNAD》低一些。而且首发一周还有20%的折扣，各位玩家走过路过不要错过啦ヾ(´･ω･｀)ﾉ
与CLANNAD相似，本作内置了类似“Dangopedia”的叫做“Busterpedia”百科内容，旨在向不懂日本文化的外国人科普相关知识。
话说这是第几版LB了，单就PC来说，LB、LBEX、LBPE还有这部基于PE版登录Steam的HD化新作English Edition……炒冷饭我还是服KEY，每部作品都翻来覆去的炒。[spoiler]炒完冷饭沉迷玩音乐，新作《Summer Pockets》就给了张图到处宣传然后沉迷演唱会、发专辑，这家唱片公司还挺敬业的，什么时候出《Summer Pockets》的初回版新专辑啊，我都等不及要去听了(#滑稽)[/spoiler]

[u]背景[/u]：KEY社的作品多取自人类的各种情感，《Kanon》里的爱情、《AIR》和《CLANNAD》的亲情等，这些很容易触动人内心那抹柔软的主题下的文本配上质量极高的配音和BGM很难让人不沉浸其中，跟随游戏人物体会历程的酸甜苦辣。本作也抓住了我们生活中不可缺少的友情，以打棒球(正经脸)为线索，打出了让我们的主角直枝理树一步步学会坚强的最珍贵的友情。还在质疑剧情质量的玩家，只要你可以推完大篇幅的日常剧情，坚持到棗铃线之后，相信我，虽然我不能保证你会喜欢上后面的剧情，但它一定不会让你失望。

[u]画面[/u]：一如既往的上架HD（所以说智代AFTER是怎么搞的嘛w）不同于CL和星之梦的HD，本作的HD化分辨率比例从4:3增强到16:9，迎合主流显示器分辨率比例，全屏游玩无黑边，给你更加畅爽的游戏体验\(´∀`o)+
本作的原画是由樋上至和Na-Ga负责的，其中樋妈负责小毬来谷三枝二木这四个人设，所以可能会在游戏的过程中有画风不一的违和感，也算是正常现象。

[u]语言[/u]：虽然本作没有中文，但是也加入了日语，日语英语可以在游戏内随时切换，这点也算很良心了[spoiler]虽然对于本萌新来说没什么区别〒▽〒[/spoiler]话说KEY社你的官中计划进行的怎么样了啊，CL官中也是半点新消息都没有(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻

[u]音乐[/u]：KEY社的音乐我就不夸了，在这里拿本作的音乐举几个例子吧：OP《Little Busters! -Ecstacy Ver.-》作为我最喜欢的三首OP之一[spoiler]顺便安利另外两首《鳥の詩》和《only my railgun》没听过的同学可以试一试(๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧[/spoiler]音符里跳动着蓝天下[spoiler]本垒打[/spoiler]青春[spoiler]棒球[/spoiler]的旋律ヽ(✿ﾟ▽ﾟ)ノ怠惰困倦的时候听上一遍，老夫身心都会精神起来，好像回到年轻时候在班级里挥洒青春汗水的高中时代（你还是个在校大学生啊喂（´v｀））
不仅仅是OP，在游戏的过程中从日常欢快令人舒适的BGM到离别悲痛，甚至剧情崩坏浑身发毛到探寻世界秘密让我大气不敢出，音乐真的占有非常大的加分成分。KEY社作品的音乐一直没有让我失望过。[spoiler]毕竟唱片公司嘛，游戏只是他们一时兴起不务正业的产物=￣ω￣=[/spoiler]

最后，还请大家跟随理树君一起，探寻Little Busters所在世界的秘密吧！

36186609.review:
Let me open this review by saying I'm extremely biased. Little Busters changed me, it set my life on a course I never would've expected and allowed me to meet so many fantastic people, it shaped who I am as a person, and became part of who I am. I'll always remember one day I was in Tokyo wearing my Little Busters jumper and a salaryman excitedly shook my hand and did the muscle dance with me. This is a work which affects people on a deep and personal level. This is not an objective review, it's just the musings of one of those people it impacted. I'm writing this review based on the old fan translation of the game.

Little Busters sets up with a very humble presentation. A bunch of childhood friends in high school do a bunch of wacky stuff together to pass their time, a clique full of such unique energy that the rest of the student body can't possibly ignore them, many drawn to them and wanting to join in. The game is full of silly minigames that will keep you coming back and complement the story nicely; I've spent many hours chilling out with the batting practice, it's the perfect stress relief. It's hilarious and heartwarming watching their circle grow and the scale of the shenanigans increase, it takes me back to an idyllic representation of youth, where I could just laugh with my friends every day without a care.

But please, don't mistake Little Busters for a comedy series. Little Busters is a story about youth, and the process of growing up, and it doesn't shy away from the harsh realities that come with that process. It's about finding one's own identity, clashing with the identites of others, and finding a way to live. Each character in the story feels very much a real person, and they all have their own crises to deal with in their process of growing up. The writing is beautiful, and you'll find yourself hitting the screenshot button every other minute. It's positive representation of mental health issues and it's atypically feminine male lead is particularly praiseworthy.

But that's not all, Little Busters is filled with intrigue thanks to an overarching mystery that gradually presents itself throughout the various character routes, culminating in the most incredible final route of any visual novel I've read. And then there's the EX routes which are available in English for the very first time!

If you open the game and you find the characters and dialogue very annoying, maybe Little Busters isn't for you. But if you find it charming and funny, stick with it, because you're only going to fall deeper and deeper in love with all the cast. Little Busters is one of my favourite works of fiction ever, and if even just a few new people come to experience it through this release, then I'd be very happy.

If you love beautifully written stories featuring a wide cast of immensely lovable characters, then I hope you'll give this wonderful visual novel a chance.

There's also a secret ending about the school getting taken over by muscle mania, that's a thing.

36186211.review:
[h1]Маленькие проказники - еще один пример годной визуальной новеллы от студии Key, которую можно порекомендовать абсолютно всем, если только у вас нет аллергии на повседневность.[/h1]
Спустя продолжительно время мы наконец сможем прочесть доп. руты 3 героинь, которые включает в себя стим версия (а это между прочим около 15 часов чтения, новые игры и новые персонажи). Если вы уже знакомы с командой проказников, то у вас даже не возникнет вопроса о покупке, но для новоприбывших опишу за что можно их полюбить и с головой окунуться в этот замечательный мир:
  Для начала вам стоит впервые зайти в меню и потратить минут 5 на осознание того, что вас уже окутывает атмосфера проказников (именно здесь я и попался). Далее вы уже переходите к самой истории и постепенно знакомитесь с персонажами. Абсолютно каждый значимый персонаж здесь обладает своим запоминающимся характером и историей, которым будет очень сложно не сопереживать и не проникнуться. Сама же история воплощает в себя обычную закономерность большинства работ Кей: вначале вас встречает юмор и радость, игривость и озорство; дальше это плавно перетекает в трагикомедию и драму. Но не стоит думать о том, что если все идет по 1 плану, то ничего интересного вы не увидите - все как раз таки наоборот, сюжет очень интересен и главное живой. Не сказал бы, что руты героинь являются чем-то выдающимся (некоторые очень хороши, другие слабее), но вот Рефрен (2-ая часть основного рута) очень сильно подымает планку и держит в напряжении вплоть до самого конца. И все это под очень атмосферную и приятную музыку, а также привычную рисовку Key.
На данный момент русского языка в стиме не имеется. Время чтения: около 80 часов. [h1]Главное не забывайте, что Маленькие проказники - это история про друзей, где все завязано на отношениях между друзьями, их переживаниях и времяпрепровождении. Удачи вам и приятного чтения.[/h1]

36185088.review:
EDIT: Okay, the sound wasn't working, but once I switched my output to "stereo" it worked. Hopefully that gets fixed soon and the game will still work if you have surround sound on...

Other than that, this is without a doubt the best visual novel I've ever played. 
Key and Jun Maeda are truly geniuses when it comes to manipulating the emotions of the player.

At first glance, the game might seem a bit cliche with the basic scenario of the protagonist being a normal guy meeting a bunch of girls and helping them out, but the core of this story is so much more than that. 
The characters and their interactions are absurdly fun and draw you in like no other.

It's a LONG game, but it's worth it for sure.

That's the game content itself, but now that I've played this version a bit I can talk about the port.

Honestly, I'm not a fan of this HD version. The game is better off being 4:3 instead of 16:9.
All the CGs are zoomed in on to get them widescreen, and in order to see the whole image you have to hide the text box and scroll back with the mouse wheel.

In addition to that, there's a bunch of options missing from the game menus and keyboard shortcuts that it doesn't tell you about. Things like 'A' for auto mode and 'Q' for going back to the last choice.
The manual tells you about the shortcuts, but you can't remap them in-game.

The original game engine used the same menus and layout as Clannad, which is also on Steam, and I think that version worked better.
This port caters too much to touch screens for my liking, and switching the aspect ratio was a mistake in my opinion.

Bad port aside, this is still my favorite visual novel, and if you're the type of person who can fall in love with fun and quirky characters and get immersed in a lengthy story that drags you through an emotional roller coaster, then this game is for you.

39276951.review:
I think it is impossible to discuss the value of Little Busters! without focusing on how it achieves to be a successful emotional ride. Did I cry or was I moved? Yeah, I did, something like seven years ago when I first read it. This time around, after the Steam release, I found myself much less impressed by some portions of drama which, admittedly, oftentimes feel just thrown around for the sake of exasperating the melodrama. Also, the plot is mostly goofy and juvenile, some nice spins are given here and there, while the prose does its job it is largely mediocre, and if you won’t find the humour and the chemistry between the characters compelling you’re in for a tour de force rather than a pleasant tale about friendships.

However, the thing about the power of Little Busters! is how being aware of all of its shortcomings doesn’t affect my appreciation of the work Visual Art’s did here, at all. Maybe Little Busters! wouldn’t work magnificently as a story, but it sure is impressive as a visual novel: whilst many similar works would limit themselves to introduce characters and let you focus on a fixated path following which one interested you the most, Little Busters! add far more branch and choices, sometimes seemingly pointless, to let the player experience a bountiful of side contents, comedic or lore-related vignettes, and secrets hidden all over the place that just ask to be found. There’s also the gameplay, in the form of several quick mini-games which range from baseball practice to a fighting tournament, from hunting down mysterious creatures (which give a pretty hilarious insight on the character of Kyousuke) to serving in a cafeteria. And the impressive thing is how all of these are plot related, not because how the gameplay fits into the story but how because how much they reciprocally influence each other. I can’t emphasize enough how I adore the way this novel build around its theme by slightly changing, after each playthrough, some minor bits of it to give a more concrete idea of the characters changing and developing after major events, and the more obvious way to notice this would be, in fact, to check the protagonists’ stats at the beginning of each tournament.

As the story is in its surface state, I wouldn’t think much of it beside it being a heart-warming bildungsroman focused on friendship, but the care put into its every detail, from the immense content hidden in it to the game direction heavily helping the narrative with a pretty fitting musical score and spot-on CG events, raised it to being of my favourite product of its medium.

38975855.review:
"Do you know the secret of this world?"

Pra você que ainda não comprou o jogo, ou comprou e está prestes a começar... eu só posso te desejar um boa sorte.
Não deixe de aproveitar cada dia, cada interação, cada momento...
Não tenha medo de se apaixonar, não tenha medo de tomar suas escolhas, não tenha medo de seguir em frente. Não deixe de rir quando for o momento, não deixe de chorar quando for a hora. Pois depois de várias e várias horas de leitura, quando você tiver completado toda a história, não há nada mais nada menos que tu possa sentir a não ser uma vaga melancolia... um remorso... por ter de deixar pra trás todos estes personagens, todo esse cenário que você passou muitos dias frequentando, vivendo. Não há como não sentir tristeza ao saber que você nunca mais vai participar dos planos extaordinários do Kyousuke, nunca mais vai ver as brigas hilárias entre Masato e Kengo, os combates insanos dos membros da equipe ou os treinos diários ao por-do-sol no campo... É tudo tão mágico. A sensação de entrar em uma rota e descobrir mais e mais sobre aquela personagem, os mistérios levantados pelos acontecimentos ao longo da história... são coisas que aos poucos instigam sua curiosidade, elevam a sua imersão na história pra no fim de tudo... você alcançar a rota verdadeira. Refrain. Ah, Refrain...

Deu pra entender, não deu? Se eu continuar vou acabar me tornando sentimental demais nesse texto.

Little Busters! com certeza é uma experiência inesquecível daquelas que você só tem uma vez na vida (como todo jogo da Key). Como Visual Novel te entretem do início ao fim e te deixa com um gostinho de quero mais no final. É por isso que essa versão é uma benção por possuir rotas extras mesmo após o fim do cenário principal pra deixar sua paixão viver por mais algum tempinho.
E eu recém terminei uma delas (Saya) e posso dizer que foi INCRÍVEL, ouso dizer que superou várias da história principal.

Tudo em HD, interface linda, trilha sonora espetacular... Mandem brasa.

MISSION START!

39457516.review:
One of the most popular of Key's VNs, Little Busters' English release was anticipated by many. And while it's not quite what I hoped for, in the end I can say that it deserves its reputation.

Little Busters is focused on a group of characters who form a baseball team. It consists of five childhood friends and a growing number of additional female members (who make up most of the heroines). A large part of the game (one of the best parts, actually) is devoted to their interaction with each other, whether they're just talking with each other, practice for the upcoming baseball match or just fooling around. The game does a good job in representing every main character and make them sympathetic, before things get real. Some may become annoying, but I ended up even caring about the ones I didn't think much of at first.

After all that come the character routes and... that's where the biggest problem with this VN is. While they vary a lot, most of them are pretty underwhelming, especially after Clannad, which has pretty strong character routes, and aside from two (one of them only in hindsight), none of them really left me satisfied by the end. While none of them are outright bad or uninteresting, they ended up pretty disappointing.

However, it's still worth it to go through all of them, as at the end waits Refrain, the main part (aside from the common route) of the VN. In typical Key manner, it takes the characters you've come to love and puts them through the wringer, tests their newfound strength and reveals a tragedy that turns everything upside down. While the character routes aren't that good, Refrain is a great conclusion that pays off everything.

This version of Little Busters contains three additional routes, that originally appeared in Little Busters EX, and are unlocked after finishing Refrain (and really shouldn't be read before it, either way). While they're not amazing either, I found they're of a more consistent quality than the main routes and all of them are quite enjoyable. One is a continuation of one of character routes (and really improves on it), another is pretty much the predecessor of Angel Beats and the other one is particularly interesting if you like cats (but probably not so much if you hate them). None of them are necessary, but all of them are nice and worthwhile additions.

A surprisingly large, but not really important, part are the minigames. None of them are necessary to progress, LB is a pure visual novel in that regard, but success can unlock additional scenes. And they're generally quite fun, but the baseball practice in particular can be quite time-consuming and monotonous when you start the game over all the time (which you really should do after finishing a route, as the common route constantly changes).

The art is really good, much better than in Clannad (and not just because of an additional artist). The adjustement to widescreen is a bit odd, though, as the CGs are still in the old format and merely zoomed in to fit the screen. It's not a big deal, though, as they still show everything important and can be zoomed out to see the full artwork.

The music, while good, is somewhat underwhelming, especially after Clannad's more consistent soundtrack. However, it grew on me with time, there's still lots of good stuff and the most important tracks are real standout pieces. The voice acting, however, is great. All voices fit well to their characters and hit all necessary emotional ranges. Only real flaw is that the protagonist is only partially voiced, not unusual for VNs, but still rather disappointing.

Despite underwhelming character routes, Little Buster is a great visual novel with a strong beginning and end, carried by a cast of sympathetic characters. Recommended for fans of VNs (although those are probably already aware of it) and people interested in the medium.

39597043.review:
[h1] Do you know the secret to this world? [/h1]

Made by the same people who brought you Angel Beats! and CLANNAD, Little Busters! is one of the most impactful visual novels I have ever had the privilege of reading. With its gripping storytelling and emotional plotlines, this is a visual novel that I highly encourage anyone to read. Originally I thought this was another comedic slice of life VN, however, I have never been proven more wrong in my life. Little Busters! will take you on a wild journey, where you will experience many emotions such as joy, sadness, anger, and grief. In the end, you will walk away knowing that you have experienced one of the greatest stories ever written. 

One of my favourite parts about Little Busters! is the soundtrack. Personally, I care a lot about a game's soundtrack and Little Busters! has some of the best OSTs I have ever heard. The soundtracks do an amazing job of setting the mood in scenes. This is especially apparent during the emotional scenes, where the soundtrack plays a very important role in allowing the reader to fully immerse themselves into the experience. A good soundtrack can make the difference between a good VN, and a great VN. 

Little Busters! has a cast of very memorable characters. All the characters in Little Busters! are well-written, and on the surface they may appear a certain way, but as one reads further into the VN, they will discover all the layers and depth that is behind said character. I enjoyed how Little Busters! made all the character relationships very intricate and detailed. There is so much to discover about the characters, their backstories, and where they come from. The more time I spent reading this VN and interacting with the characters, the more intimate I felt with all them. Little Busters! does an exceptional job of creating bonds between the reader, and its cast, where everything comes into play for the final route known as Refrain. 

The story is masterfully crafted, and very layered. I expected nothing less from Key, who is remarkable at storytelling. In short, it is about a young boy known as Riki Naoe. As a child, Riki suffered from depression, but was saved by a group of four kids who called themselves "The Little Busters." Now in high school, they all attend the same school and the story tells of Riki's adventures with the Little Busters, as well as his high school life. Containing over eighty hours of playtime, I am astonished by how lengthy this game was and it only adds to my already immense respect for it. From witty jokes, to extremely heavy and serious scenes, Little Busters! has it all. The story is very detailed, and there is a lot to take in. 

I will never forget my time with Little Busters! It is without a doubt one of my favourite visual novels I have read, and I hope it will be the same for you. Little Busters! left a mark on me, and it taught me many valuable lessons. It contains many themes, some of which one could even relate to. I will always hold Little Busters in high regard because of the experience I had, as well as the unbreakable bonds I have forged with its characters. If I could erase my memory to experience something for the first time again, it would have to be this visual novel. 

I usually don't post reviews, but I made an exception for this one. If you read all the way to the end, I thank you for your time and hope you decide to take on the unforgettable journey that is Little Busters!
